CommonFields.Title: Preparation, characterization and properties of PLA/TiO2 nanocomposites based on a novel vane extruder
Author: Zhang, Haichen
Huang, Jintao
Yang, Li
Chen, Rongyuan
Zou, Wei
Lin, Xiangkun
Qu, Jinping
CommonFields.Location: National Engineering Research Center of Novel Equipment for Polymer Processing, The Key Laboratory of Polymer Processing Engineering of the Ministry of Education, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou 510640, People's Republic of China

Drying-Evaporation.Description: dried in vacuum for more than 6 hours
dried in vacuum for more than 6 hours

Mixing.Description: PLA and TiO2 was premixed in a high-blender

ChooseParameter.Other: extrudent was subsequently granulated by a pelletizer

Drying-Evaporation.Description: Tensile test specimens were dried in vacuum oven prior to injection molding

MoldingInfo.Description: barrel temperatures for the injection were set at 170, 180,185 and 190 C from hopper to the nozzle, respectively

Transmission_Electron_Microscopy.EquipmentUsed: JEOL (JEM100XII) field emission transmission electron microscopy

Dynamic_Mechanical_Analysis.Description: measurements were taken in temperature range of 0 to 100 C at heating rate of 3 C/min

HeatingRate.description: heated from rt to 200 C and held for 3 mins

Thermogravimetric_Analysis.Description: heated at rate of 10 C/min from rt to 500 C under air atmosphere

Rheometery.Description: measurements were performed in dynamic oscillatory mode. Parallel cone-plate were 25 mm in diameter

HeatOfCrystallization.description: back calculated with ΔHo (93.6 J g−1), the heat of crystallization of a 100% crystalline PLA
